Hey, you just told everybody how to beat that problems:  keep the 
doors closed.  Why do think I put so many doors around those slime?  
In general, I like complete control.  However, the brag has certain 
problems with keeping enemies from fighting each other.  I have added 
more doors in attempt to keep the monsters from penetrating, but they 
insist on breaking through.

> Is it a gameplay problem? If there's something wrong with one of my

> I'll fix it. I have to wonder if there are certain conditions under 
which 
> the enemies use more of their abilities than they normally do. I've 
made 
> levels where the enemy mages use warp space a lot, and some where 
they just 
> don't. I can't figure out what triggers them to do this.

You are probably right,  Under certain conditions, certain 
characters use certain attacks more often.  Maybe the folks at FSGames 
can explain character behavior better.

Slime seem to love to multiply when there is plently of space, but 
given the same amount of space in a different situation, the slime 
will not multiply (Slime Lords - the slime that are isolated sometimes 
split, sometimes not).  I would love to know what it would take to 
guarantee slime multiply evertime, druids summon faeries, etc.

The biggest defeciency (IMHO) with coding is what to the character 
does when it has max magic power.  If the scenario is completely 
defeated, slime should not multiply, mages should not freeze time, 
druids should not be growing trees, summoning faeries, etc.  On the 
other hand, if the scenario is not defeated the following should 
occur:
  slime should be growing/splitting [that would make slime truely     
scary] when they reach max magic power.  
  Archmages should be summoning images/fire elementals instead of 
leaving teleporter markers.
  Clerics should be actively looking to raise undead and heal team 
mates.  
  Druids should be summoning faeries.
  you get the picture.

IMHO, the most powerfull attacks are those in which you increase the 
number of your teammates.  Summoning images/fire elementals, raising 
undead, and summoning faeries are among the most powerfull attacks.
 
> I never really liked ghosts. In all honesty, I prefer levels with 
normal

My only problem with ghosts is that it is difficult to control where 
they are.  For that reason, I will not use ghosts in any scenarios 
where there are multiple teams.  However, I am using ghosts a lot in 
my scenarios on the ocean.
